bug.author: Yorko
bug.summary: AMP wants the model to be first sent to CUDA device
bug.description:
Describe the bug When training with fp16, AMP says that we need to provide a model with parameters located on CUDA.
The problem is reproduced in <denchmark-link:https://www.kaggle.com/kashnitsky/distillbert-catalyst-amazon-product-reviews?scriptVersionId=22987225>this Kernel</denchmark-link> (Version 3). Expected behavior Expect the model to train normally Screenshots Calling runner.train <denchmark-link:https://camo.githubusercontent.com/83918a0b6252403766f7e1de9b358da35a7dfc4e3bf6d91e11b6f5896937db2d/68747470733a2f2f686162726173746f726167652e6f72672f776562742f66642f72702f30692f666472703069347536757a7868796435776a61667563316b3377302e706e67></denchmark-link>
Getting error: <denchmark-code>When using amp.initialize, you need to provide a model with parameters located on a CUDA device before passing it no matter what optimization level you chose. Use model.to('cuda') to use the default device. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://camo.githubusercontent.com/6fd6e22b3f7cebae24cb7b0010e7c2c7f3cce3d78e5d28abee15f5f52ed4815a/68747470733a2f2f686162726173746f726167652e6f72672f776562742f61312f696d2f766f2f6131696d766f3077736e76327675646467647465676c68753075612e706e67></denchmark-link>
Additional context The problem is solved if I pass model=model.cuda() to runner.train. But I don't think it's designed to be done like that. Catalyst version is 19.11.

comments.comment: The issue happened when using Kaggle. Strange. This is not reproduced on my machine. Trains fine.
I had same issue when I use Catalyst 19.11. on google colab. When I change the version to 19.10, the error didn't show up.
Looks like it's fine now, same <denchmark-link:https://www.kaggle.com/kashnitsky/distillbert-catalyst-amazon-product-reviews>Kernel</denchmark-link> , 11th version. Closing.
